author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: إِلَيْكَ وَمُقْبِلِينَ إِلى شَطْرِ رِضاكَ، وَإِنَّكَ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ عَلَى ما تَشآءُ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ المُتَعالِ العَزِيزُ الغَفَّارُ، ثُمَّ اقْبَلْ يا إِلهِي مِنْ عَبْدِكَ
translation: Grant, therefore, I beseech Thee, that their hearts may be inclined towards Thee, and that their faces may be turned in the direction of Thy good-pleasure. Powerful art Thou to do what Thou willest. No God is there but Thee, the Inaccessible, the All-Glorious, the Ever-Forgiving.
